why_join: I studied pure finance during my undergrad, and I’m aiming for a career in finance, especially in risk management roles. I believe these skills will make me more competitive when applying for jobs in this field.

For example, analyzing sentiment from financial news or identifying patterns in textual data from company reports can provide deeper insights into market behavior. This approach can help improve predictive accuracy and support more informed strategic decisions in risk management.

cons: I'm a bit concerned about whether I can balance the coursework of this class with the pressure of my ongoing job search.

why_join: I signed up for this course because I am keen to explore the intersection of technology and finance. Text mining offers a unique way to uncover insights from unstructured data, such as financial reports, news, and social media, which are increasingly influencing economic and financial decision-making. I believe this course will provide me with valuable skills in natural language processing and data analytics that are highly relevant in today's data-driven economy.
future_plans: In the future, I plan to apply the knowledge and techniques learned in this course to analyze market trends, assess investment opportunities, and gain deeper insights into economic behavior. For example, I would like to use text mining to study the impact of news sentiment on stock price volatility or to evaluate the tone of earnings calls to predict company performance. Additionally, these skills will be instrumental in my career in financial data analytics or economic research.
pros: I am looking forward to gaining hands-on experience with text mining techniques and applying them to real-world economic and financial datasets. Exploring how text data, such as news articles or financial reports, can influence market trends and economic insights excites me. I’m particularly eager to work on projects that involve analyzing sentiment or extracting actionable information from large-scale unstructured data.
cons: I am slightly concerned about the steep learning curve associated with mastering new tools and techniques, such as advanced natural language processing algorithms, especially if they involve extensive coding or mathematical complexity. Additionally, ensuring I can manage the workload alongside other commitments is another potential challenge.

why_join: Because I think it is really practical and useful in both academic and working environment and am keen on applying text mining skills into applicable scenarios in real world.

For instance, as a risk quant in an investment bank, you can leverage text mining to analyze vast amounts of unstructured data, such as news articles, financial reports, and social media posts, to identify potential risks and opportunities. By extracting relevant information and detecting patterns, you can enhance risk assessment models, predict market movements, and make more informed investment decisions. This approach can help in monitoring market sentiment, detecting early warning signals, and improving the overall risk management strategy of the bank.
